title: Task icons with color coding, presenting complaint on dashboard, and PDF export

requirements.text: On the Dashboard view, display the presenting complaint as visible information on each case card/entry, alongside the existing patient info (MRN, name, species, etc.).

quotes: On the Dashboard page include the presenting complaint in visible information
On the Dashboard include presenting complaint

acceptanceCriteria: The presenting complaint field is visible on each case entry on the Dashboard without requiring expansion or interaction.
If a case has no presenting complaint, the field is either hidden or shows a graceful placeholder.

requirements.text: Replace the open dot indicators for checklist tasks on both the Dashboard and Cases pages with meaningful icons chosen based on task type, styled with the following color scheme: Green (#22c55e) for Discharge Notes, Yellow (#eab308) for pDVM Notified, Orange (#f97316) for Labs, Purple (#a855f7) for Histo, Blue (#3b82f6) for Imaging, Red (#ef4444) for Surgery Report, Pink (#ec4899) for Culture. Use the same color-coded icon system in the ChecklistEditor and CaseCard components. Icons should be sourced from an existing icon library (e.g., lucide-react) and chosen to visually represent each task type (e.g., a file/clipboard icon for Discharge Notes, a microscope or flask for Labs, a camera or scan for Imaging, etc.).

quotes: Change open dots to icons for the various tasks, same on the cases page

Choose the icons based on the task types and make them using the following color guide: Green — Discharge Notes, Yellow — pDVM Notified, Orange — Labs, Purple — Histo, Blue — Imaging, Red — Surgery Report, Pink — Culture

acceptanceCriteria: Each task type on the Dashboard and Cases pages is represented by a distinct icon (not a dot).
Each icon is rendered in the specified color for its task type.
The same icon+color system is used consistently across the Dashboard, Cases list, CaseCard, and ChecklistEditor components.
Completed tasks are visually distinguishable from incomplete ones (e.g., dimmed, strikethrough, or checkmark overlay).
The CHECKLIST_ITEMS definitions in checklist.ts are updated with the correct icon and color for each task type.

requirements.text: Add a Download/Export PDF button that generates a table-formatted PDF report of all cases that have remaining (incomplete) tasks. The report must include all case fields: MRN, patient name, presenting complaint, species, sex, age, arrival date, surgery date, attending clinician, and the list of outstanding tasks per case. Each outstanding task should be displayed using its task label. The PDF should use a landscape table layout. Implement this using the existing generateCasePdf.ts infrastructure or extend it as needed.

quotes: Add ability to export cases with remaining tasks to a table formatted PDF
Download button to generate a PDF report
Table/case card format showing all case fields (MRN, name, outstanding tasks, etc.)
Displays all cases with their remaining tasks

acceptanceCriteria: A clearly labeled Download or Export PDF button is visible on the Dashboard or Cases page.
Clicking the button generates and triggers download/print of a PDF report.
The PDF contains a table with columns for all case fields: MRN, patient name, presenting complaint, species, sex, age, arrival date, surgery date, attending clinician, and outstanding tasks.
Only cases with at least one remaining (incomplete) task are included in the report.
Outstanding tasks are listed per case using their human-readable task labels.
The PDF uses a landscape orientation and table layout for readability.

constraints: Do not modify any files under frontend/src/hooks/ (immutable paths).
Do not modify files under frontend/src/components/ui (immutable paths).
All icon choices must come from an already-available icon library (e.g., lucide-react) — do not add new external dependencies unless strictly necessary.
Color values for task icons must match the specified color guide exactly: Green=Discharge Notes, Yellow=pDVM Notified, Orange=Labs, Purple=Histo, Blue=Imaging, Red=Surgery Report, Pink=Culture.
No backend changes are required for these features.
nonGoals: Adding new task types not already defined in checklist.ts.
Changing the PDF export to a server-side rendering approach.
Modifying the authentication or user profile system.
Adding filtering or selection UI for which cases appear in the PDF (all cases with remaining tasks are always included).
